intro: Curculigo pilosa subsp. minor, commonly known as the small-leaf arrowhead, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the wet season. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
